newsitem.title: UK: London tea auction - Demand easier, still good.
newsitem.headline: London tea auction - Demand easier, still good.

text.p: Demand was good but not so strong as at the last sale on March 24 at Monday's tea auction in London.
The best price realised was for a Kenya PD at 178 pence compared with 195 for a Burundi PD.
Bright East Africans came to a selective market with prices irregular and following quantity. Mediums met good competition at fully firm to often dearer rates.
The offshore sector saw better liqouring Kenyas and Zimbabwes sell well at firm to dearer levels but others were irregular and tended lower.
